intro: Psychotria erythropus, commonly known as the red-eyed beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with white petals, often adorned with prominent yellow stamens. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, with a dark green coloration.
